intro: Gonatopus boivinii, commonly known as the Boivin's spurge, is a flowering plant belonging to the Euphorbiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its distinctive yellow-orange flowers and milky sap. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with upright stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain areas.
